OptionDisplayGroup.name: groupEmbersRekindled
OptionDisplayGroup.Description: Distribution options for Embers Rekindled Ores.

OptionChoice.name: enableEmbersRekindled
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation handle Embers Rekindled ore generation?

Choice.description: Use Custom Ore Generation to handle Embers Rekindled ores.
Embers Rekindled ores will be handled by Minecraft directly.

OptionChoice.name: cleanUpEmbersRekindled
OptionChoice.Description: Should Custom Ore Generation use the Substitution Pass to remove all instances of Embers Rekindled ore from the world? If the mod's oregen can be turned off in its configuration, then it's recommended to do so, as the substitution pass can slow the game significantly. If this option is disabled without disabling the mod's own ore generation, you'll end up with two oregens working at once, flooding the world with ore. Enabled by default to ensure the ores are completely removed.

Choice.description: Use the substitution pass to clean up Embers Rekindled ores.
Embers Rekindled ores do not need to be cleaned up by a substitution pass.

Choice.Description: Wide, thin, and flat disks of ore.
Small, fairly rare motherlodes with 2-4 horizontal veins each.
Simulates Vanilla Minecraft.

Choice.description: Quartz is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.name: embrQuartzFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for Embers Rekindled Quartz distributions

OptionNumeric.name: embrQuartzSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for Embers Rekindled Quartz distributions

Choice.Description: Small, fairly rare motherlodes with 2-4 horizontal veins each.
Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore.
Simulates Vanilla Minecraft.

Choice.description: Copper is not generated in the world.

OptionNumeric.name: embrCopperFreq
OptionNumeric.Description: Frequency multiplier for Embers Rekindled Copper distributions

OptionNumeric.name: embrCopperSize
OptionNumeric.Description: Size multiplier for Embers Rekindled Copper distributions

OptionChoice.name: embrMountainCopperDist
OptionChoice.Description: Controls how Mountain Copper is generated

Substitute.name: embrOverworldBlockSubstitute0
Substitute.Comment: The global option deferredPopulationRange must be large enough to catch all ore clusters (>= 32).

Cloud.name: embrQuartzCloud
Cloud.Description: Wide, thin, and flat disks of ore. Primarily, this distribution is meant to provide realistic distribution of stone in a strata formation.

Veins.name: embrQuartzVeins
Veins.Description: Small, fairly rare motherlodes with 2-4 horizontal veins each.

StandardGen.name: embrQuartzStandard
StandardGen.Description: A master preset for standardgen ore distributions.

Veins.name: embrCopperVeins
Veins.Description: Small, fairly rare motherlodes with 2-4 horizontal veins each.

Cloud.name: embrCopperCloud
Cloud.Description: Large irregular clouds filled lightly with ore. These are huge, spanning several adjacent chunks, and consequently rather rare. They contain a sizeable amount of ore, but it takes some time and effort to mine due to low density. The intent for strategic clouds is that the player will need to actively search for one and then set up a semi- permanent mining base and spend some time actually mining the ore.

Veins.name: embrCopperHintVeins
Veins.Description: Single blocks, generously scattered through all heights (density is about that of vanilla iron ore). They will replace dirt and sandstone (but not grass or sand), so they can be found nearer to the surface than most ores. Intened to be used as a child distribution for large, rare strategic deposits that would otherwise be very difficult to find. Note that the frequency is multiplied by ground level to maintain a constant density, but not by ore frequency because it is assumed that the frequency of the parent distribution will already be scaled by that.

StandardGen.name: embrCopperStandard
StandardGen.Description: A master preset for standardgen ore distributions.

Veins.name: embrMountainCopperVeins
Veins.Description: Small, fairly rare motherlodes with 2-4 horizontal veins each.

StandardGen.name: embrMountainTinStandard

Veins.name: embrSilverVeins
Veins.Description: Large veins filled very lightly with ore. Because they contain less ore per volume, these veins are relatively wide and long. Mining the ore from them is time consuming compared to solid ore veins. They are also more difficult to follow, since it is harder to get an idea of their direction while mining.
